item.title: An autonomous web crawler
item.description:
Project Background

Our team developed a Dashboard for multiple stakeholders. While the users were happy with the dashboard, manual pipelines were time-consuming. To enhance efficiency, our team decided to create an automated crawler to directly populate a database with the same data previously stored as CSV files on sharepoint.

Project Outcome

Upon recognizing the primary challenge, we swiftly developed and automated a crawler. We set it to run daily through the Windows Task Scheduler. However, despite preparations, the anticipated data delivery didn’t materialize as expected. This setback left stakeholders eagerly awaiting crucial insights, highlighting the pressing need for a solution.

We successfully addressed this issue using a try-except loop. After a few hours of dedicated effort, the crawler was reinstated and resumed its consistent delivery of insights on a daily basis. Subsequently, our focus shifted to table normalization and seamless integration into our database.

The crawler has since operated harmoniously within our task scheduler, undergoing occasional adjustments to ensure its continued optimal performance.
